meanings.definition: To put or set in the ground for growth
meanings.sent1: I planted the seeds in the soil to make them grow.
meanings.sent2: She planted flowers in her garden to make it beautiful.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel planted acorns all over the yard, hoping for a forest.
meanings.sent4: His words planted doubt in her mind, growing like a weed.
meanings.sent5: The idea he planted in my head blossomed into a great plan.

meanings.definition: To establish or settle in a place
meanings.sent1: They planted their flag on the mountaintop to claim it as their own.
meanings.sent2: The family planted themselves in the new neighborhood and made friends quickly.
meanings.sent3: The cat planted itself on the warm windowsill, refusing to move.
meanings.sent4: Her smile planted happiness in everyone's hearts, making the room brighter.
meanings.sent5: The memories they planted in my mind will stay with me forever.

meanings.definition: To place or fix in a certain position
meanings.sent1: He planted the sign firmly in the ground so it wouldn't fall.
meanings.sent2: She planted herself in front of the TV, not moving until the movie ended.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous elf planted the toy spider on the teacher's desk, causing a stir.
meanings.sent4: The idea planted in his head took root and grew into a firm belief.
meanings.sent5: The image she planted in my mind was so vivid, I could almost touch it.
